results.title: Johura
results.creator_credit: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Johura lives on an island on a river in Bangladesh with her husband and small children. They are very poor and, to supplement their income, Johura makes an arduous journey every day into Dakkha where she works as a machinist in a textile factory. Her life is hard, yet she strives to educate her own children as well as those of the neighbouring shanties. Franca Arena introduces her story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: Johnson and friends. - Volume 3.
results.brief_description: Johnson, the fearless pink elephant, leads his friends in six new stories: The toys organise a surprise “Birthday party” for Johnson and must work together save their friend “Alfred” from being thrown away. “Battle of the bed”: the whole room and all the toys are at war. The toys become suspicious of themselves as McDuff loses her medal in “A case of trust.” Johnson wants to go to hospital with Michael in “Blast off” but how will he manage it? “The concert”: there was a show under the bed, it was starting that night and all the toys had stagefright!

results.title: Johnson and friends. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Johnson, a courageous pink elephant, leads his friends on a daring adventure into the darkness under Michael’s bed. They stumble upon Alfred, a gruff hot water bottle lurking in the shadows. McDuff, the cheeky concertina, squeals in surprise as Diesel the dump truck and Squeaky the battered robot head for safety. Michael’s cluttered bedroom is the setting for the captivating series of adventures and misadventures which draw together this irrepressible band of toys.

results.title: Johnson & Friends
results.brief_description: Johnson and Friends is one of the most beloved Australian kids shows, airing on the ABC in the perfect timeslot between school and dinner. It featured toys that came to life and starred ACMI CEO Katrina Sedgwick as McDuff.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1990s
constellations_other.description: In the 1990s, Australians and Australian culture was changing: so too were the representations of it on television.

recommendations.quote: Before Katrina Sedgwick landed the lead role at ACMI, she starred in a range of iconic TV shows and movies, including The Last Wave (1977) and E Street (1989). But our favourite role of Katrina's is the cheeky concertina McDuff in Johnson and Friends (1990–95).

results.description: Johnson and Friends is an Australian children’s television programme broadcast on ABC from 12 November 1990 to 25 December 1995. It was produced by Film Australia and lasted seven seasons. In the UK it was shown in the 1993 on TCC, CBBC, and then on UK Living’s Tiny Living strand for under-fives. It was aired in the United States as a segment on the Fox Cubhouse, an educational children’s program on Fox, from 1993 to 1996.
description_for_label: Johnson and Friends is an Australian children’s television programme broadcast on ABC from 12 November 1990 to 25 December 1995. It was produced by Film Australia and lasted seven seasons. In the UK it was shown in the 1993 on TCC, CBBC, and then on UK Living’s Tiny Living strand for under-fives. It was aired in the United States as a segment on the Fox Cubhouse, an educational children’s program on Fox, from 1993 to 1996.

results.title: Johnny Suede
results.creator_credit: Tom Di Cillo, Ruth Waldburger, Yoram Mandel, Starr Pictures, Arena Films and Balthazar Pictures
results.brief_description: An independent off-beat cult classic about an aspiring rock musician with a complicated love life and an obsession for suede and his own carefully cultivated self-image. Johnny (Brad Pitt) is a naive but endearing musician who models himself on the 1950s pop legend, Ricky Nelson. After a pair of black suede shoes fall on him from the sky one night, he adopts the name Johnny Suede and spends his time composing inspired love songs on his guitar that add greatly to the comic and somewhat bizarre quality of the film as he dreams of rock ‘n’ roll stardom. He meets the sensuous painter Yvonne (Catherine Keener) and begins a journey of self discovery that will never quite leave his carefully fabricated image the same again, or will it? Written and directed by Tom DiCillo, who followed this genuine and beautifully odd ball effort with ‘Living in Oblivion’(1994), said to be inspired in part by his experiences in making this film, and including a cast that features Nick Cave and Tina Louise. (Awards: Golden Leopard Award for Best Film, 1991)

results.title: Johnny Mnemonic
results.creator_credit: Robert Longo, Don Carmody and ANM
results.brief_description: A snapshot of the future, the year 2021. Corporations rule and the world is threatened by a new plague, NAS; Nerve Attenuation Syndrome. To protect data it must be smuggled through mnemonic carriers who carry the data through a computer chip implanted into the brain; Johnny Mnemonic (Keanu Reeves) is one such carrier. Johnny’s present mission is to carry data from two scientists who have defected from one of the world’s largest corporations, taking the information from Japan to America. The upload of information carried in Johnny’s brain surpasses anything he has carried before and he must find the secret access code that will allow him to download the information, otherwise he will die. Also starring Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi Kitano, Ice-T and Dina Meyer.

results.title: Johnny Guitar
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Herbert J. Yates and Republic Entertainment International
results.brief_description: A reformed gunfighter returns to a woman he had abandoned years earlier. She is now the proprietor of a gambling saloon opened in anticipation of the arrival of the railroad and in the face of hostile opposition from the local townspeople. The film’s bizarre, even baroque, intensity derives in part from the central antagonism between two women (virtually unique in the western), and in Yordan and Ray’s expressed intention of seeking an anti-McCarthy parable.

results.title: Johnny got his gun
results.brief_description: This is the ultimate anti-war film by writer/director Dalton Trumbo. The setting is World War I and a nameless, armless, legless, faceless hospitalised soldier is found to be conscious despite the extreme condition that his body remains in after an explosion. His isolation and freakish state causes unease and anguish to the viewer. The horror that he faces is broken up through the film with flashbacks of the soldiers life before the war. “Johnny Got his Gun” is a very important film which is both thought-provoking and distressing. Trumbo received the 1971 Fipresci Prize and was nominated for the Golden Palm at Cannes. Cast includes Timothy Bottoms, Jason Robards, Donald Sutherland, David Soul and Diane Varsi.

results.title: Johnny Flynton
results.brief_description: Johnny Flynton is a 2002 American short film directed and co-written by Lexi Alexander. It was nominated for Best Live Action Short Film at the 75th Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Powerful women in the frame and behind the scenes
constellations_other.description: Lady Sarah (Rachel Weisz) exudes power in The Favourite. These female filmmakers and actors do too.

results.description: Johnny Flynton is good at one thing: boxing. He’s not too bright, and there’s clearly some issues in his past, but what’s worse, when he’s boxing, his temper flares up. His wife, Samantha, tells him she’s pregnant. Meanwhile, he’s got an exhibition match with local boy Artie Duane. Johnny lets him get a few punches in to look good, but when Artie starts taking cheap shots, Johnny can’t stand by and overreacts. He runs home, where he’s in high spirits, but that proves his downfall.
